title: Alert
description: Displays a callout for user attention.

usage.description: You can use one of the two classes: alert or alert-dialog.
usage.content:
Success! Your changes have been saved

This is an alert with icon, title and description.

html_examples.content:
Something went wrong!

Your session has expired. Please log in again.
This is a very long alert title that demonstrates how the component handles extended text content and potentially wraps across multiple lines

Success! Your changes have been saved

This is an alert with icon, title and description.

title: Alert Dialog
description: A modal dialog that interrupts the user with important content and expects a response.

usage.description: The Alert Dialog component is identical to Dialog except for two small differences: we do not display a close button and we do not let the user close the dialog when clicking on the backdrop (no onclick attribute on the <dialog> or the <article> elements).
usage.content:
Are you absolutely sure?

This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete your account and remove your data from our servers.

title: Avatar
description: An image element with a fallback for representing the user.

usage.description: Avatars are fairly simple to implement with Tailwind. The example above shows how to implement one with Tailwind and an element. More examples can be found in the kitchen sink.

title: Badge
description: Displays a badge or a component that looks like a badge.

usage.description: Use one of the badge classes: badge, badge-primary, badge-secondary, badge-destructive or badge-outline.

html_examples.content: Primary
Secondary
Destructive
Outline

title: Breadcrumb
description: Displays the path to the current resource using a hierarchy of links.

usage.description: This example uses some simple Tailwind CSS styles along with the Dropdown Menu component (which may require JavaScript).
usage.content:
1. Home
  5. Components
  7. Breadcrumb

title: Button
description: Displays a button or a component that looks like a button.

usage.description:
You can use one of the btn classes to style any element as a button:

Variants:
btn or btn-primary for primary buttons,
btn-secondary for secondary buttons.
btn-destructive for destructive buttons.
btn-outline for outline buttons.
btn-ghost for ghost buttons.
btn-link for link buttons.
btn-icon for icon buttons. This can be combined with other variants, for example btn-icon-destructive.
Sizes:
btn-sm for small buttons.
btn-lg for large buttons.
You can combine sizes with any variant, for example btn-lg-destructive or btn-sm-icon-outline.

html_examples.content: <button class="btn">Primary</button>
<button class="btn-secondary">Button</button>
<button class="btn-destructive">Destructive</button>
<button class="btn-outline">Outline</button>
<button class="btn-ghost">Ghost</button>
<button class="btn-link">Link</button>

<button class="btn-icon-outline">
  <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="m9 18 6-6-6-6" /></svg>
</button>

<button class="btn">
  <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M14.536 21.686a.5.5 0 0 0 .937-.024l6.5-19a.496.496 0 0 0-.635-.635l-19 6.5a.5.5 0 0 0-.024.937l7.93 3.18a2 2 0 0 1 1.112 1.11z" /><path d="m21.854 2.147-10.94 10.939" /></svg>
  Send email

title: Form
description: Building forms with Basecoat components.

usage.description: Adding the form class to the parent of any form element (<label>, <input>, <textarea>, <select>) will automatically apply the style you would get from adding label, input, textarea, or select classes. Read more about Label, Input, Textarea, and Select.
usage.content:
This is your public display name.

You can manage email addresses in your email settings.

You can @mention other users and organizations.

Your date of birth is used to calculate your age.

Email Notifications

Receive emails about new products, features, and more.

Receive emails about your account security.

title: Input
description: Displays a form input field or a component that looks like an input field.

usage.description: Simply add the input class to your <input> element or have a parent with the form class. You can also set the aria-invalid attribute to true to make the input invalid.

html_examples.content: <input class="input" type="email" placeholder="Email">
<input class="input" type="email" placeholder="Email" aria-invalid="true">
<input class="input" type="email" placeholder="Email" disabled>
Fill in your email address.
This is your public display name.

<!-- Opens the `#main-navigation` sidebar -->

<!-- Closes the sidebar -->
<button type="button" onclick="document.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent('basecoat:sidebar', { detail: { action: 'close' } }));">Close sidebar</button>

Email Notifications

Receive emails about new products, features, and more.

title: Slider
description: An input where the user selects a value from within a given range.

html_examples.content:
<input
  type="range"
  class="input w-full"
  min="0"
  max="100"
  value="50"
>
<script>
  (() => {
    const sliders = document.querySelectorAll('input[type="range"].input');
    if (!sliders) return;

    const updateSlider = (el) => {
      const min = parseFloat(el.min || 0);
      const max = parseFloat(el.max || 100);
      const value = parseFloat(el.value);
      const percent = (max === min) ? 0 : ((value - min) / (max - min)) * 100;
      el.style.setProperty('--slider-value', `${percent}%`);
    };

    sliders.forEach(slider => {
      updateSlider(slider);
      slider.addEventListener('input', (event) => updateSlider(event.target));
    });
  })();
</script>

<input
  type="range"
  class="input w-full"
  min="0"
  max="100"
  value="50"
>
<script>
  (() => {
    const sliders = document.querySelectorAll('input[type="range"].input');
    if (!sliders) return;

    const updateSlider = (el) => {
      const min = parseFloat(el.min || 0);
      const max = parseFloat(el.max || 100);
      const value = parseFloat(el.value);
      const percent = (max === min) ? 0 : ((value - min) / (max - min)) * 100;
      el.style.setProperty('--slider-value', `${percent}%`);
    };

    sliders.forEach(slider => {
      updateSlider(slider);
      slider.addEventListener('input', (event) => updateSlider(event.target));
    });
  })();
</script>

title: Theme Switcher
description: A component that allows the user to switch between light and dark mode.

html_examples.content:
<script>
  (() => {
    try {
      const stored = localStorage.getItem('themeMode');
      if (stored ? stored === 'dark'
                  : matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches) {
        document.documentElement.classList.add('dark');
      }
    } catch (_) {}

    const apply = dark => {
      document.documentElement.classList.toggle('dark', dark);
      try { localStorage.setItem('themeMode', dark ? 'dark' : 'light'); } catch (_) {}
    };

    document.addEventListener('basecoat:theme', (event) => {
      const mode = event.detail?.mode;
      apply(mode === 'dark' ? true
            : mode === 'light' ? false
            : !document.documentElement.classList.contains('dark'));
    });
  })();
</script>

<!-- Toggles the theme -->
<button type="button" onclick="document.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent('basecoat:theme'));">Toggle theme</button>
<!-- Sets the theme to dark -->
<button type="button" onclick="document.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent('basecoat:theme', { detail: { mode: 'dark' } }));">Set dark theme</button>

title: Toast
description: A succinct message that is displayed temporarily.

html_examples.content:
<button
  class="btn-outline"
  hx-trigger="click"
  hx-get="/fragments/toast/success"
  hx-target="#toaster"
  hx-swap="beforeend"
>
  Toast from backend (with HTMX)
</button>

<button
  class="btn-outline"
  onclick="document.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent('basecoat:toast', {
    detail: {
      config: {
        category: 'success',
        title: 'Success',
        description: 'A success toast called from the front-end.',
        cancel: {
          label: 'Dismiss'
        }
      }
    }
  }))"
>
  Toast from front-end
</button>

<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/basecoat-css@0.3.1/dist/js/basecoat.min.js" defer></script>
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/basecoat-css@0.3.1/dist/js/toast.min.js" defer></script>

Success

A success toast called from the front-end.

<button
  class="btn-outline"
  onclick="document.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent('basecoat:toast', {
    detail: {
      config: {
        category: 'success',
        title: 'Success',
        description: 'A success toast called from the front-end.',
        cancel: {
          label: 'Dismiss'
        }
      }
    }
  }))">
  Toast from front-end
</button>

title: Tooltip
description: A popup that displays information related to an element when the element receives keyboard focus or the mouse hovers over it.

html_examples.content: <button class="btn-outline" data-tooltip="Add to library">Hover</button>
<button class="btn-outline" data-tooltip="Tooltip text" data-side="bottom" data-align="center">Bottom left</button>
<button class="btn-outline" data-tooltip="Default tooltip">Default</button>
<button class="btn-outline" data-tooltip="Right side tooltip" data-side="right">Right</button>
<button class="btn-outline" data-tooltip="Bottom side and start aligned tooltip" data-side="bottom" data-align="start">Bottom + Start</button>
